1.title: Citadel Records

11.content:
The Asari are a humanoid species that hold one of three permanent seats on the Citadel council at the start of the game. All Asari are mono-gendered, although they display, from a human point of view, female characteristics, with the ability to bear and nurse children. Their reproductive and dual nervous systems allow them to mate with any species or gender, with whom the offspring is always female and of the Asari race. The Asari are capable of participating in and enjoying physical sexual contact. However, to produce offspring, they form a mental and spiritual connection with their partners, and by doing so, draw genetic material which is combined with their own to produce offspring resulting in an offspring that is primarily Asari in genetic makeup, however it might possess recessive traits from the father species. For example, a child that is the result of a union between a Krogan and an Asari might inherit Krogan disease resistance. Sexually, the Asari could be considered as xenophilic, as not only are they indiscriminate in regards to the races of their mates, but prefer to mate with other races, believing that the genetic and racial traits of other species, when combined with Asari genetic make-up, is of benefit to the Asari race as a whole. Conversely, they tend to attach a stigma to those born "pureblood" between two Asari, as they believe that nothing is gained when two Asari procreate (although most are too polite to openly speak of their prejudices). Their homeworld of Thessia is composed of an interconnected system of city-states, similar to those of medieval Italy.

Of all the species in Council space, the Asari are the most widespread, powerful, and respected, due in part to their being the first species since the Protheans to achieve interstellar flight, to discover and learn how to use the Citadel, and their position as a founding member species of the Citadel Council. Despite this, the Asari are open in their service to others, to the point where there is no cultural stigma attached to performance arts, even sexual ones. This has led to salacious rumors of Asari promiscuity, which they consider unfounded.

Of all the galactic species, the Asari are the most economically powerful; their culture, products and entertainment dominate the galaxy. They are governed by a loose democracy, known as the Asari Republics, and are known to be politically centrist, favoring stability that is conducive to cultural and economic development. Politically, they practice a form of direct democracy that could only be described as an e-democracy, where citizens contribute to the general consensus via a huge interconnected network. However, they also have a matriarchal council that heed the will of the people and make decision for their welfare accordingly. The Asari can live for a thousand years going through three stages in life; the Maiden stage (lasting to 350 years), an energetic phase in life in which an Asari is considered a youth and setting the initial course of her life; the Matron stage (lasting from 350-700 years) where an Asari draws back to a more deliberative phase and begins to lay the foundations of a family and her place in society (though some Asari have been known to start families as early as 100 years old), and finally the Matriarch phase (700-1,000 years) where the Asari takes her place among the elite in society, participating more in cultural and political affairs and generally leading the next generation to fruition.
11.title: Asari

111.content:
Here are 2 Asari characters to get this ball rolling.

Isha Navera: Ever since her early Maiden years, Isha wanted to be a officer of law. Forgoing the usual Maiden choices in life, Isha devoted herself to training and learning as much about police procedures as possible. Eventually she became a C-Sec officer, working on one of the upper wards on the Citadel. She took her duties seriously, and eventually her ward became crime free. Her superiors took notice and suggested she become a Specter, which she accepted. Standing a 6'7'' due to odd genetics, Isha towers over most other races. Her centuries of training have also given her an slim but athletic build. She is very serious-minded: she always put her job before anything else.

Kana D'tevo: Kana is an rarity: an Asari born with no biotics and unable to receive any. Although bullied because of this, Kana let nothing get her down. She joined the Alliance to show she could be useful without biotics. But, during a mission to a junk planet, her team was ambushed by Geth, leaving her partners dead and her badly injured. After undergoing extensive surgery, Kana was left with a cybernetic arm, leg, and eye. But she continued to fight, eventually rising to the Specter ranks. Kana stands at 5'7'' with a slight athletic build. Her cybernetic limbs are pure silver and her cybernetic eye is purple with black sclera. She is optimistic and proud to be a fighter.

12.content:
Salarians, who possess one of the three permanent Citadel Council seats, are a species renowned for their mental acuity, technical skill and their high aptitude for espionage. Salarians have a very high metabolism rate, lowering their life expectancy to about 40 Earth years, but also necessitating very little sleep, around 1-2 hours per day.

In the interstellar community, they have created many of the major technological advances that now fill the galaxy. Highly intelligent, their mental acuity is galactically renowned. In fact, they are considered to be hyperactive by most other races; Salarians, however, disagree with this prognosis, considering other races to be slow and dim-witted.

They favor political liberalism, making them a counter-balance to the conservative Turians and centrist Asari on the Citadel Council. The Salarian Union is largely governed by a group of dynastic families ruled by female elders. Of the three permanent Council species, their economy is the smallest, but is still substantially larger than that of the human Systems Alliance. The Salarians were responsible for the elevation of the Krogan race to combat the invading Rachni, and they were subsequently responsible for creating the "Genophage" biological weapon used to quell the later Krogan Rebellions. Militarily, they are considerably weaker than the Turians in head-on combat, preferring to employ sabotage, reconnaissance, counter-intelligence and commando operations against any enemy. However, in unconventional warfare, the Salarians are perhaps second to none. They excel at information gathering and while they consider outright direct war to be a last resort, once they do engage in war, it's almost always by surprise (they see a declaration of war as strategically unsound) and by a strategically dominant force - after all, they've long since figured out what and who they are fighting against and how their foes are going to fight.

Salarians are not notably religious, but as free-willed sentients there are exceptions. One of the less-favored Salarian religions (which the Council deems a "cult") worships a goddess, and claims that a certain pattern of overlapping craters in the southern hemisphere of Trelyn resembles her. There has also been a small movement towards a kind of "wheel of life" form of pantheistic reincarnation that has taken root to a limited extent among Salarians.

In the novel Mass Effect: Ascension, a "Salarian Lystheni offshoot" is mentioned. It can be speculated that the Lystheni are a criminal organization similar to the racist, human organization Cerberus as the novel describes them as "those unwelcome in Citadel space", it could also be speculated that they are a Salarian subspecies.
12.title: Salarian

13.content:
The Turians were the last of the Citadel species to join the Council. The Turians gained this position after defeating the Krogan for the Council during the "Krogan Rebellions", employing a Salarian-developed biological weapon called the "Genophage", which virtually eliminated the possibility of new Kogan births and caused that species to go into a steady decline.

Turian features are avian in nature, resembling Terran birds or raptors. Most also have tattooed-on markings on their faces whose design and color denote which colony or system they were born or raised in. This cultural observance was first developed during the Unification War, in which various Turian colonial holdings fought each other for territory and influence within the Hierarchy; however, years of infighting made most of them too weak to oppose the unifying influence of the Hierarchy itself. Outmatched, they accepted unification under the Hierarchy's leadership, but the markings remained. There are some Turians who do not have face markings; during the war, they were typically Hierarchy loyalists and were referred to degradingly as "bare-faced". While Turians without markings are no longer singled out as such, the slur remains and is commonly used to imply that certain Turians are "politicians" or "untrustworthy"; in Turian, these terms are synonymous and interchangeable.

Turians have a reputation for skill and bravery in combat, but are not considered bloodthirsty. In combat, Turian units are highly adaptable and highly disciplined. Turian lines rarely break, even in highly disadvantageous circumstances; they will retreat and withdraw if necessary, but will do so in an orderly fashion, setting up vicious rear-guard actions and ambushes along the way. A rigid code of honor and strict discipline are the hallmarks of any Turian officer or enlisted-man. This includes humane treatment of prisoners and conquered enemies. A Turian unit will never willingly leave behind one of their own, no matter what the cost of going back to retrieve their comrade. Turian society in general is very honor-bound, concerned with the performance of one's duty, regardless of one's role in society. All Turians work for the glory of the state and most are state-employed in some way. Military service is mandatory for all Turian citizens, as well as client races who wish to become full Turian citizens. While there are some Turian criminals (a rather low number due to the typically Turian devotion to the state and to society), even they maintain a level of conscience unheard of by criminals of other races; a Turian criminal will, like most other beings, attempt to evade capture and consequence for their actions, but once caught and taken into custody, he or she will almost always to admit their guilt and accept due punishment (which, in Turian jurisprudence, is often harsh). Despite this preoccupation with law and order, many are surprised by the importance Turian society places on personal freedoms. Turian society allows for freedom of speech, religion and the practice of practically any activity that does not harm or undermine the state. There are Turians who are known to observe and adhere to Asari and even human religious practices; there is an increasingly large segment of Turians who are known to practice Confucianism and/or Zen Buddhism, as well as some earth-originated monotheistic religions.

Their species is governed by the Turian Hierarchy, a collection of military leaders and autocrats, and of the three permanent council races, they possess the largest military force, even if they are not as powerful as the technologically, diplomatically and economically superior Asari. As such, they are largely employed as the front line of the Council's combined military forces. Most Council peacekeeping forces are made up principally by Turians, and Turians are also the largest racial group employed in the Council Office of Special Tactics and Reconnaissance (Spectres) and Citadel Security Services (C-Sec, the station's law-enforcement body; it was the Turians who suggested the agency's formation). While autocratic in nature, Turian Hierarchs almost never cross the line into tyranny or despotism, for devotion to the well-being of the people is ingrained into every Turian from childhood. Politically, the Turians are conservative, paying great observance to tradition, duty, loyalty, honor and the preservation of the status quo. Still, they generally get along well with most other races. There is a great deal of hostility between the Turians and the Krogan for obvious reasons, and there is a lingering degree of distrust and enmity between the Turians and the human race, the bitter memories of the First Contact War still very fresh for both races. However, the Turians still greatly respect the military tactics and aptitude of the humans as demonstrated against them in battle during the reclamation of the human colony of Shanxi. The rate of human colonization, material wealth and influence within the Council is known to irk some prominent Turians, but there is a grudging respect between the two races.
13.title: Turian

14.content:
Humans in Mass Effect are generally similar to those in modern day life, although more technologically advanced. Human society in Mass Effect is both similar and dissimilar to modern human society. Independent and separate nations still govern various landmasses on Earth. In regards to the galaxy at large however, the Systems Alliance is the face of humanity.

The Systems Alliance is a multi-national independent entity supported by the various nations of Earth that is, for all intents, its own political, governmental, and military entity; it controls and manages all off-world activities. A recent addition to the galactic stage when the game is set, human society advanced significantly with the advent of interstellar travel, made possible with the discovery of lost Prothean technology.

Humans quickly expanded outwards and established more and more colonies on uninhabited planets. This rapid expansion brought them into contact with the Batarians and Turians, with whom they quickly came into conflict. The human-Turian First Contact War brought humans to the attention of the species of the Citadel Council.

Due to the System Alliance's quick and effective military response to the Turian occupation of the human colony of Shanxi and the stunning defeat of the Turians at the hands of this relative newcomer to galactic politics, the Citadel Council wasted no time in mediating an end to the war and gave the human race considerable latitude in their colonization efforts, much to the dismay of the Batarians, who abandoned their Citadel embassy in protest. In the brief decades since their appearance, humans have quickly risen to prominence. In addition, humans have recently been given an embassy at the Citadel as associate members of the Citadel Council.

Humans are seen by most galactic races as intelligent, aggressive, and highly adaptable. Their brisk population growth and rapidly developing military strength have led to resentful speculation that the newcomers will soon be given an invitation to become full members of the Council, at an unprecedented rate.

Due to their military aptitude and rising force levels, they are limited by the First Contact War-ending Treaty of Farixen, which limits the Alliance military to 1/5th the number of dreadnought warships the Turians possess. In order to gain diplomatic recognition and respective associate member status on the Council as well as an embassy on the Citadel, the Systems Alliance agreed to this stipulation.

During the game, Commander Shepard (the main character) comments on the difference between the lifespans of the Asari and humans, saying that humans are "lucky if they reach 150", therefore implying that humans have extended their average lifespan by several decades.[2] It is also revealed that humanity makes extensive use of in utero genetic screening and engineering to eliminate or repair many congenital defects. Genetic engineering is also used (mostly by the wealthy) to enhance appearance, physical ability, and mental acuity.

(Some where in the Harvest Cluster 2 weeks after the Geth attack on Citadel Station.)

Over the planet Harvest 4 a human destroyer slowly passes over the night side of Harvest 4. At 350m long she was currently running at stand-by stations just incase anything were to happen which everyone on bored doubted. She was one of the newest ships in her class she ran a light haze grey from the time of Sols water bound vessels, with two black stripes running from her forecastle to aft. She bore the symbol of the Human Alliance Navy proudly on her starboard amidships. On the port side forward her named had been put in white lettering SSV Forgotten Dreams. She carried four small lasers her primaries as well as two medium sized lasers do deal with larger targets those being added in later in development as it was deemed necessary after the Geth had showed just how badly they outnumbered all the other civilizations when it came to ship power.

It was quiet on the nav-bridge as a solo human stood on the raised platform looking at a display of the Harvest system and its five planets and its blue Alpha phase sun. The man looked to be in his late twenties nearing his thirties on his shoulders he bore the ranking of a human Commander. Quietly one of the other officers approached the captain.

"Sir we have completed our perimeter orbit over Harvest 4 what are your orders?" asked the lieutenant

"Take us out Mr. Davidson lets return to home." Said Roth calmly

"Aye sir. Pilot take us to course 370 mark 281 and begin uploading the codes for the jump to Sol system." said Lieutenant Davidson

"Coming around to course 370 mark 281 aye. Beginning the upload of ships code for the jump to Sol system now estimated time of arrival in the Sol system is approximately thirty minutes.” replied ensign Rosten the pilot of the ship

Down in the engine room the newly designed engine based off of the SSV Normandy began to power up and ready the ship for intersystem warp to the Prothean jump gate that would send them home to Sol.

"Jumping to the gate in 3... 2... 1 Jump!" shouted Rosten as the ship made the unnoticeable leap into warp taking the ship from Harvest 4 to the gate.

"Lieutenant if anyone needs me I'll be in my cabin understood?" asked Roth leaving the nav-bridge heading to the elevator

"Aye sir understood." replied Davidson
1411.title: End of Patrol

14111.content:
Run Martha run!" shouted Danny running from their attackers who had just killed every one in the city

"I can still hear them their still coming!" shouted Lin

The sound of rifle fire could be heard as well as cannon fire as what little defense was left of this colony tried to fend off the invading force. No one had seen where they had come from as the attack was so sudden no one saw it coming. The local garrison had sent a distress call out earlier to call for any help but so far that call had gone unanswered. Now the capital city of Tarna Vos was destroyed razed by fire from both side almost all the in habitants of the city dead or dying. It was utter chaos to describe it.

"There the shelter we can hide in there!" shouted Martha

Both Danny and Lin followed Martha into the bunk and locked the door behind them to ensure they wouldn’t be found by the enemy. Seconds past and nothing happened but the sounds of the battle kept growing louder as reinforcements from other parts of the system came to help. But the sounds also grew closer and soon the whole bunker was shaking from each impact as cannon fire exploded all around their bunker.

Then a lull came over the battle field followed by a tremendous roar of an explosion from somewhere outside as the power inside the bunker flickered off.

"What just happened?" asked Lin

"I don’t know but it didn’t sound good" said Danny

a second later the hatch blew inwards and in walked a dark figure with a singular glowing light to show it where to go. Strange noises could be heard from the creature every one kept silent hoping it wouldn’t find them. After a little bit the things turned around and began to leave. As it began to leave Danny accidentally knocked over something instantly alerting the thing as two more of the things filled into the room.

Then the power came back online and revealed who the creatures were for the three to see. It was the Geth! Their robotic bodies unmistakable in this light. But as they saw the Geth the Geth also saw them and raised their rifles and fired tearing the three humans to shreds another one said something in their strange language and they headed out leaving the bloody bodies where they lay.
------------------------

Commander Roth headed to his room which was at the very end of the hall on the third level. Opening the door reveled a room of not much in one corner was a single bed to sleep in another was a desk covered with paper work and a screen on a wall with the symbol of the human Alliance Navy on it.

"Well I guess its time to get back to work and fill out those damn papers." Roth said walking to his desk and sitting down

After about twenty five minutes of paper work Roth’s intercom buzzed for his attention.

"What is it?" he asked activating the intercom

"Sir we are approximately five minutes out from Sol sir thought you would like to know. However we are receiving a priority call from Alliance command on Sol sir shall I patch it threw?" asked the comms officer

"Yes please do." replied Roth walking over to the screen with the Alliance Navy symbol on it.

A second later the face of a human female appeared on her shoulders she bore the rank of a captain.

"Good evening Captain Dalaya what can I do for you?" asked Roth obviously being a smart ass

"Cut it out with the bull shit Roth it doesn’t suit you." She said crossing her arms

"Well then lets get to the point just what is it you want me and my ship to do now?" Roth asked

"I need you to go check on the Reyk system we just received a distress signal from that system about an hour ago." Dalaya said

"Reyk system? isn’t that in the Verdant Ridge Nebula area?" asked Roth

"Yes it is. And before you ask no they cant Admiral Duath is currently engaged in other duties in the nebula with the second fleet. All other vessels are currently in the yards getting refitted and repaired after that Geth stunt not to long ago you are currently the only one who is able to react fast enough to be of any use." Dalaya explained

"You know your going to owe me another drink for this Captain you know that right?" said Roth

"It wouldn’t be the first in fact I believe this would be the thirtieth one you said I will owe you for making you go out instead of letting you come back in." Dalaya said with a grin

"Some times Dalaya the only reason you ever send me out is so I can’t collect on those drinks." replied Roth smiling back

"You have your orders Commander carry them out Captain Dalaya out." and with that the connection cut out

Well there goes that shore leave I had planned for the crew. Lets just hope this isn’t a waste of all our times. Roth thought returning to the bridge.

"Captain on deck!" shouted the young enlisted by the door as Roth exited the elevator

"As you were." Roth said walking to the nav-bridge

"Sir we are approximately one minute from hitting the Sol gate." said lieutenant Davidson

"Good. Pilot begin plotting an instant gate jump to the Reyk system as soon as we enter the Sol system." said Roth giving out orders

"Aye sir beginning now."

"Sir are we not returning to Sol today?" asked lieutenant Davidson

"Negative we are need in the Reyk system apparently one of the colonies there has sent a distress signal out about an hour ago and we have been tasked with finding out what the problem is."

"But isn’t the Reyk system fall within Admiral Duath and the second fleet's patrol area shouldn’t he take care of it?" asked Davidson

"Yes it does however the Admiral and the second fleet are currently engaged in other matters and we are currently the only available vessel so it’s our job to go see what’s up in the Reyk system." Roth replied

"Now you have your orders I expect this ship turned around and ready to hit that gate the second we exit warp understood?"

"Aye sir will do"

"Good weapons officer begin a check of all ships weapon systems I want them ready for anything should we find something out there."

"Aye sir"

"All right people we have a job to do now let’s go out there and do it and get home before they lay another job on us." said Roth as every one went about their jobs getting everything ready.
14111.title: Having to stop by Reyk before heading home

141111.content:
The Reyk system is your basic system with nine planets and a middle aged k-type star. The only notable thing about this system is that on the planet Reyk III an asteroid belt surrounds it where a moon would be destroyed probably by some cataclysmic event that tore it asunder. Inside the belt many valuable ores necessary in the building of ships can be found making the Reyk system an up and coming ship building system. The planet Reyk III is the current capital of the Reyk system with a population of 6 million people mostly humans.

----------------------

"Exiting to jump into Reyk system in 10." called the pilot as the ship was preparing for another false alarm or possible pirate raid.

The ship falls out of jump approximately 10 km away from the Prothean Mass Relay the relay looking like a giant weapon itself rather then a station/ jump relay.

"Shields engaged weapons energized starting initial scans of the system." called the pilot directing the ship away from the relay towards the inner portion of the system.

"Sir we are receiving an incoming message from Reyk III shall I put it on screen?" asked the comms officer

"Yes" replied Roth from the Nav Bridge

"To any Alliance vessel out there this is Reyk system defense we are outnumbered and being over run by Geth forces!" the man shouts as the area around him explodes from impacting shells.

"We need reinforcements immediately they have already killed a large portion of civilians and are holding the capital city of Reyk III under there control." another explosion

"We are unsure of the amount of Geth forces in the space above Reyk III but current data suggests that the majority of the Geth have left leaving a small picket of Geth ships here for an unknown reason. Please if any one hears this we need help immediately we cant hold out much longer... argh" on screen the man is shoot by a rifle and on screen a Geth walks to where the man was and stares at the screen before shooting the camera killing the feed.

"That’s it no other transmission is out going from Reyk III." said the comms officer just as shaken as the rest of the bridge crew by what they've seen.

"Sir scans are showing a small force of Geth ships around Reyk III with its shipyards mostly destroyed or damaged heavily. What is your orders sir?” Asked the pilot still flying towards the system center.

"Set course to Reyk III prepare a ground team and make ready to destroy all Geth ships in system. I want this system to be in Alliance control yesterday. This is to be assumed as a retaliatory strike against the human alliance and its allies for their defeat back at Citadel station as of now we are entering enemy held friendly space. Expect heavy resistance the Geth aren’t known for their love of humans.” Commanded Roth

“Aye, sir setting course now bringing all systems online for engagement sending out a priority call to alliance command for back up.”


“Captain we are receiving a transmission from the Reyk III’s surviving marine detachment outside the capital city Tarna Vos.”

“Patch them threw now!”

“This is Staff Sergeant Major Alex of the Reyk III marine detachment to Alliance command vessel thanks for the timely arrival we could really use some help down here.” In the back ground explosions are heard with gun fire

“KEEP FIRING DON’T LET THE THREW! Sorry as you can tell we are in a bad way and could really use some help please tell me your with the second fleet and that the rest of the fleet is behind you on their way now.” Asked the Sergeant facing the screen

“This is Commander Roth of the destroyer SSV Forgotten Dreams We read you sergeant we are on route now to clear the space over Reyk III and send down a ground team to help with the Geth. However the second fleet is currently engaged in other tasks and will not be able to provide assistance till a later time. What is the status of you and your men?”

“Fuck. Sir we are almost shit out of luck we are damn near completely surrounded in a corner near the out skirts of the city inside a large Plaza with a large group of civilians that weren’t slaughtered by the Geth during the initial assault. I am unable to contact anyone else in system or on this planet as far as I know me and my men are the last surviving marines from the Reyk III marine detachment along with our civilians.”

“How much longer do you think you can hold out for?” asked Roth

“I don’t know sir but probably for as long as this building stands most likely but I don’t know how much longer that is would advise that is if you do something you do it quick or else me my men and these civilians are all done for.”

“Acknowledge will be sending ground team as soon as the space above Reyk III is secure enough to send down a transport.”

“Copy sir please hurry… ‘BOOM’ COVER THAT HOLE! DON’T LET THEM THREW!” rifle fire is heard as shoots are fired threw wherever the hole was created the odd mechanical noise that is the Geth could be heard as well.

“Sergeant! Sergeant! Damn we need to move now how much longer till we arrive at Reyk III?!” hollered Roth

“Sir we will be arriving at Reyk III now.” Right then the human alliance ship dropped out of warp and flew towards Reyk III and its orbital shipyards or what was left of them and the five Geth ships floating around the wreckage like buzzards over a kill.

“Gunner target those ships and open up with the mediums then the small’s as we get closer. I want those computerized hunks of junk destroyed last year!” Ordered Roth

“Aye Sir, targets locked firing now.”
141111.title: The Beginning of a Bloody Day

choices: Onboard the Bridge of SSV Forgotten Dreams
1411111.content:
The two medium turrets on the SSV Forgotten Dreams port and starboard side opened fire upon the Geth ships their ruby red laser fire catching two of the ship unprepared with their shields down and causing massive damage to them sending secondary explosions threw their hulls that eventually destroyed the two.

Every one on the Bridge gave out their own hollers in joy over the destruction of two of the enemy ships. With the destruction of two of their own the Geth were caught completely off guard and proceeded to open fire at extreme range with the own weapons filling the space above Reyk III with their own green laser fire.

The second barrage of the mediums striped one of the ships of their shields completely and crippled it to where it was no longer anything but drifting junk. Now within range the Geth lasers started to hit their mark better but still most of their shoots went wide with range and evasive maneuvers from both sides decreasing the chances of hits. The crippled Geth ship in an attempt to disable or destroy the SSV Forgotten Dreams self destructed sending out a characteristic emp pulse that stripped any ship within the blast range of their shields.

The Blast hit both remaining Geth ships and the SSV Forgotten Dreams taking away all their shields. When the blast hit the alliance ship a malfunction appeared in the electronics for the medium turrets disabling them.

Now with no shields and the advantage of range gone the battle came down to a “Knife Fighting” range where the smaller turrets on the destroyer would be next to useless in order to prevent the Geth’s lasers from firing properly either as the safety mechanics for any turret prevented firing at anything at extreme close range so as to prevent any possible damage caused by an exploding ship or debris to collide and destroy something important on the ship.

With the range closed to “Knife Point” the SSV Forgotten Dreams pulled hard to their port rolling over on of the Geth ships with the port side stabilizer creating a gash in the Geth ships hull that if it were a human vessel would have created a vacuumed death to all on board but as it was a Geth ship all that happened was to have the Geth inside sucked into space leaving the ship a drifting hulk with no crew inside.

The range now open some bath the SSV Forgotten Dreams and the remaining Geth ship instantly opened fire on each other. As they continued to open fire the SSV Forgotten Dreams regained the use of its mediums and opened fire with them at the Geth ship.

With both mediums and the small turrets raining death down upon it the Geth ship never stood a chance. Inside the Geth ship could have been a computerized hell as all the electronics inside fried and exploded the Geth inside working as fast as their servos could to keep firing to destroy the human alliance vessel and live despite the extremely slim chances. Then like a small sun going Nova the Geth ship exploded creating a small shock wave of fire and emp that washed over the SSV Forgotten Dreams like a tidal wave.

Once passed all that was left in space was floating wreckage from the Geth ships and their one lifeless ship, and a very badly damaged Human Alliance destroyer with a destroyed port stabilizer with burns marks going across the hull. Just the fact the ship was still overall intact aside from a couple of hull breaches and the port stabilizer provided a testament to human building design.
1411111.title: The battle over Reyk III

choices: continue as Commander Roth Doru Areaba
continue as Staff Sergeant Major Alex
14111111.content:
Inside the ship was what could be akin to a post mini-war fight scene where there were attackers and defenders firing at each other destroying anything and everything between them. Wires were hanging from where they used to be hidden in the lagging from the sight of the crew. Small electrical fires where being brought under control by the ships crew the ships own fire protection system having failed halfway threw the battle. There were also the casualties the crew members who had the misfortune to have gotten injured in any number of various ways were being taken care of by the ships medic who was also hurt some but not a lot.

Back on the bridge the bridge crew was managing to keep things together despite having the bridge having so many of the consoles destroyed and useless. Every one was injured in some manner no one managed to escape unscathed from this battle. And standing up on the Nav Bridge was Commander Roth just as badly hurt as everyone else.

“Status report.” Asked Roth leaning upon the rails on the Nav Bridge as he regained his bearings from just watching his ship and her loyal crew just pull threw a battle with little to no loss of life at all and the most major damage to the ship was the loss of the port stabilizer that was supposed to be use to stabilize the ship as it entered and exited warp threw the Prothean gates.

“Sir current estimates put our hull integrity at 45% armor strength at 15% and shields at 5% and climbing slowly. Also we have received massive damage to our port stabilizer rendering us incapable of using Prothean gates or warping between systems. Also we have damage to multiple subsystems as well as some primary ones as well. We no longer have long range scanners as well as damage to our medium and short range turrets it would be unadvisable to use them for any long duration while they are in their current state.”

“Sir we are receiving another transmission from the survivors on the planet.” Came forom the comms officer

“Put it threw” replied Roth diverting his attention

“Sir we could really use that help right now the Geth are pushing harder now and managed to push threw the first line we cant hold much longer request immediate assistance.” Came the sergeant

“Help will be on its way in a minute sergeant just hold on a few minuets longer. Lieutenant I want the marines we have on board down in the hangar armed up and ready to go within the next minute.”

“Aye sir will do.”
14111111.title: Post space fight damage report

141111112.content:
Today was turning out to be perhaps one of the worst days of Major Alex's days as he quickly concluded firing from behind the quickly diminishing shelter he and his fellow marines were behind firing every opportunity to take down the Geth currently assaulting their position.

<Gunfire>
"Lewie see if you can throw another grenade at them followed by a kinetic toss see if we cant hold them, Every one else fire once that grenade goes off!" shouted Alex over the sound of the Geth continuing to keep them at bay.

The only acknowledgment he received was a nod from Lewie the only remaining Biotic left in their squad and several other acknowledgements from the rest of the marines.

"On three! One... Two... Three... NOW!" Shouted Alex

Lewie tossed a grenade down the corridor once it exploded he as well as every one else made to look over the cover and fire the grenade seemed to had done its job stopping the Geth temporarily. Then Lewie using his biotic implants sent a kinetic push threw the air that tossed several of the closer Geth back away from them and into the others. Alex and the rest of the marines opened fire suppressing the Geth the sound of several Geth deactivating as several of their main functioning components were destroyed.

Once the fighting had died down the sound of fighting within the city could be heard as those not lucky enough to have made it to this fall back point were being hunted down and what little resistance the put up was easily quelled by the Geth. Sitting back down Alex tried to gain some of his former composure when his comm beeped.

"Alex here go ahead."

"Major this is ghost team Echo we are in position do you want us to take out some more Geth or hold back longer? Also it seam’s that the Geth are keeping back from the Plaza to regroup if it were my guess I would have to say there waiting to bring up the walkers." asked the leader of the sniper squad who were currently roaming threw out the city providing covering fire and foreword reconnaissance of Geth movements.

"Negative stays where you are don’t fire unless you see an opportunity to take on of the big bastards down. Also keep an eye out for any help from our friends in the sky." Alex instructed

"Aye we'll make sure to give you the heads up when they do. Ghost team Echo out." and the link was ended

"Alright listen up while we have the time everyone here who is not injured seriously I want you to help refortify this line I want our turrets back on line as soon as possible also some one make sure the civilians are doing fine. Remember don’t let your guard down if you think you see anything that looks like a Geth shoot it I don’t want to take any chance's understood?" Alex shouted to ensure he was heard.

"Good now move out marines!" he shouted once more

"Major I think now would be a good time to try and evacuate some of the civilians out of the city before we become completely over run not to mention some of our men are in dire need of medical attention." Asked Lewie second in command.

"I know I would like to evacuate them but we cant the second we get them out side they will be under fire from the Geth. I hope those reinforcements get here soon." Alex said

"I hope so to but in all honesty I doubt they'll be of much help other then to help us hold the line but not push the Geth out of the city which we need to do." Replied Lewie rubbing the back of his neck.

"Yeah but for that we would need an entire contingent of marines which I highly doubt they have..." Alex started as his comm unit beeped again

"This is Major Alex what is it?"

"Staff Sergeant Major Alex correct?" asked an unfamiliar voice

"That is correct who are you and how did you get on this frequency?" Alex asked

"I am Sergeant Francis of the 123rd Hot Drop marine battalion where do you want us at?" asked the fellow marine

"Depends what do you have and how heavily armed are you?" asked Alex

"We have supplies for your civilians and equipment to fortify a building into a fortress also we are armed out to make sure we can take you city back." Sergeant Francis answered with apparent smugness in his voice

"The supplies we are definitely going to need however as for taking the city back that is yet to be seen." Replied Alex his day starting to turn for the better.

"Also be advised the SSV Forgotten Dreams is on stand by for precision strike's on where ever you want them. Now where are our coordinates to drop?" asked the marine

"Sending now also we have a sniper team currently keeping us informed on Geth movements under the call sign Ghost team Echo." Alex informed the Sergeant

"Aye sir thanks for the heads up good to know we got eyes on the prowl, Sergeant Francis out." finished the Sergeant killing the link

"Well looks like our reinforcements will be here soon enough." Alex informed his second in command

"That's good to know now shall we get our men rea..." Lewie tried to say as the distinct sound of a starship entered the atmosphere and flew past their position several extra loud explosions could be heard as it sounded like the passing star ship fire on several positions of the Geth.

"What the hell do they think they are doing are they trying to get us all killed?” Demanded Lewie recovering from the shock waves that could be felt from the different impacts where the ship had fired on.

"Well as long as they aren’t killing any of our own and more of the Geth bastards I don’t care makes our lives easier." Alex said

"Major Alex this is Sergeant Francis from the 123rd were on the ground and moving towards your position moving under the call sign Black Crow ETA till we reach your position 10 minutes can you ask your Ghost team Echo to find safe route for us so we don’t get ambushed?" asked the Sergeant from wherever he was within the city.

"Copy will patch you threw to them glad to have extra boots on the ground." replied Alex smile on his face

"Glad to have our boots on the ground space is no place for a marine. Black Crow one out." Joked Sergeant Francis closing the connection

"Alright everyone regroup on me now listen up we have freindlies incoming to back us up and hold the line however we are going to have to hold on our own till they get here so were going to have to hold against any Geth incursion understood?" Alex explained to his marines

"AYE SIR!" they shouted their already lowered moral raised some with this news.

"Now move out Cover those holes and don’t let any Geth threw!" Alex yelled dismissing his marines.

"Major this is Ghost team Echo we have a problem the Geth are advancing upon the Plaza they have several Geth walkers and some larger Geth troops with some possible Geth shadows instructions?" asked the Ghost team leader

"Shit those walkers are going to be trouble. Alright take out the Geth Shadows if we allow them to jam our radar we can’t tell where they are moving or call in some rain on the walkers. Fire for effect I don’t want the Shadows anywhere near the Plaza remember relocate should they spot you." Alex said thinking about how much trouble the incoming Geth were going to be.

"Aye sir fire for effect Ghost team Echo out." replied the ghost leader ending the connection.

If we make it out of this alive I am definitely going to need a drink or at least some time off thought Alex moving towards his position.

1411111121.content:
To say the Geth were giving a final push would be an understatement at the numbers facing the remaining marines now. The disticnt shapes of the Geth walkers or armatures as they were called were being protected by several hundred Geth the main purpose of the walkers even being there to destroy any resistance that may come from the marines giving the Geth free field to slaughter them and the civilians inside the plaza. Among there numbers were Geth destroyer’s dreadnoughts and one Geth Prime obviously the leader of the Geth if it could be called that as Geth never seemed phased when one was destroyed but it was obvious when one was destroyed a small but distinguishable difference could be noted in the rest of the Geth actions.

"Alright men this is it we either hold the Geth here or allow them to kill our families and loved ones. I have said it before and I'll say it again I am damn proud to have had the honor to have served with all of you now lets hold these Geth HERE!" shouted Alex rasing his rifle down range a loud "HO RAH!" could be heared from the rest of the marines as they also readied to fire.

"On my mark fire on the smaller Geth and work towards the larger ones!" As the dust settled it could be seen that nearly every Geth had been destroyed or damaged beyond capable function. This new wave facing the marines now made the first look like nothing as yet more Geth came pouring into where the other Geth had been firing as they went quickly followed by still more larger Geth and several walkers but what really was counting against them was they now had a Geth walker that dwarfed the other walkers and Geth they had brought out the big guns this time the Geth would not be denied they would have their victory here and crush any resistance from any organic life. With one shoot from this monster not even Wilie's kinetic barriers could prevent them from hitting their targets.

"Fall back! Back to the second line! Move it!" Alex hollered seeing how out matched they were sure falling back would only prevent the smaller Geth from over running their position but he had to get his men out of the range of the giant Geth walker before it leveled them all into the ground.

"Ghost team Echo this is Alex fall back to a safer position it is to hot here I repeat fall back to a safer position before they spot you!" Alex also warned the sniper team before the giant walker had a chanse to destroy them.

"Aye were already moving just needing to holy shit fire fuck fire! Hurry get us threw we need to get out before that thing fires on our position... Dear god." and with that the comm cut.

Watching Alex saw the large Geth walker facing towards one of the buildings being currently swarmed by Geth troopers when it fired at the building causing major damage to it sending the building collapsing down on top of anything inside or near it as it fell. Alex didn't even bother to try and see if anyone survived as he would be wasting precious time that he didn't have instead he turned and fired at the oncoming Geth determined to take as many of the things with him before he died. Firing with the rest of the marines they layed fire on the approaching Geth holding them at bay for a while before their walkers came into range and open fire on the marines forcing them into cover more then they could afford allowing the Geth to continue onwards. Followed by the far larger Geth walkers that had decimated Ghost team Echo in one shot.

"Fall back, back inside the Plaza erect the barrier!" shouted Alex as the Geth passed another range marker setting off another set of mines that destroyed more Geth but still they came on like an army of the damned with no end in sight.

Once inside the plaza the marines erected the large kinetic shield barrier that would keep any fire from the Geth from hitting the Plaza but would not stop the Geth from simply walking threw it to reach their target.

"SSV Forgotten Dreams this is marine detachment on Reyk III we need immediate air support request you strike at these coordinates!" Shouted Alex into his comm for the currently orbiting ship to fire on the on coming Geth.

"This is SSV Forgotten Dreams we read you loud and clear be advised that we will be firing awfully close to your position recomend you find some heavy cover and stay there SSV Forgotten Dreams out."

14123.content:
Sergeant Bolden had heard the stories about what happened when the Geth found an intact body. An inexperienced soldier might have thought that hiding under the corpse of a comrade would provide safety. In reality, it invited a fate worse than death. Dead or alive, the Geth would convert any bodies they found into mindless husks. Not wanting to fall victim to such a fate drove Bolden to take action. Trying not to show any sign that he was still alive, he looked around for any weapons he could use. There was an assault rifle a few inches from his head, but it had been badly damaged in the explosion and would be useless. Having no other choice, Sergeant Bolden drew his sidearm from its hip holster and deactivated the safety.

Hiding under a corpse alone would not save the sergeant's life, but it would give him the element of surprise. He discreetly peered over his fallen companion's body and watched the Geth squad as it approached. There were just a few of them, but Bolden was in no position for an intense battle. He would have to take them all out at once. Once the squad of mechanical soldiers drew close enough, he would spring out from his hiding place and hopefully take them by surprise. Otherwise, his situation would be no better than if he had decided to remain hidden entirely.

After a moment, the enemy was upon him. The Geth point-man looked down at the corpse, and then at Lincoln Bolden's apparently lifeless face. Storing its weapon on its back, the point-man picked up the corpse. The instant it was out of the way, Bolden raised his pistol and put a round through the Geth trooper's head. Its squad-mates turned to face the falling machine, and as they did so, Bolden flung himself into an upright position and fired five more precise shots.

Sergeant Bolden stood as the last Geth trooper fell. His body was badly burned and bruised, but he lived to fight another battle. His legs were fairly undamaged, so he would at least be able to move. However, a lone, injured soldier would likely not be able to last very long against the Geth hordes, so he would have to link up with another Alliance squad, both for strength in numbers and medical attention.

Here is what crusiers are most of the time in the mass effect universe.

Cruisers are middle-weight combatants, faster than dreadnoughts, and more heavily-armed than frigates. Cruisers are the standard patrol unit, and often lead frigate flotillas. Cruisers cannot land on medium or high-gravity worlds, but do possess the ability to land on low-gravity planets.

Cruiser-weight starships are the standard combat unit encountered away from large naval bases, the "poor bloody infantry" of most fleets. Nimble scouting frigates have neither the punch nor the stamina to stand up to serious combat, and the mighty dreadnoughts are a strategic resource, carefully hoarded and committed to the most critical battles.

Cruisers perform routine independent "show the flag" patrols in settled systems and lead flotillas of frigates in small engagements, such as pirate suppression campaigns. In major fleet engagements, cruiser squadrons support the dreadnought battle line by screening their flanks against enemies attempting to maneuver for a main gun "bow shot" from their vulnerable broadsides.

But SSV Venus is an experimental ship, highly classified and hard to see because the ship is colored of matt grey and black.

"Seems like the outlaw scums are dummies after all." Said Lt. Commander Kelly.

" hummm, yeah our missiles will shread them and other targets if they are so packed."

15.content:
(note this is my own idea fora Mass Effect race. If the owner of story dose not like a fan made race its his prerogative to delete this chapter.)

Draconians are a race that resemble dragons of old earth legends. There also a vary old and long lived race that could have with out the help of Mass Relays have visited Earth in distant past but its uncertain if they did or not. As it turns out there space travel and relay usage was quite prevalent but limited they did not really desire exploration as a people but only through adventures or wild individualizes that dared to look for new adventure did one of there ship find the Citadel and make contact, this was only 10 years after the Krogen rebellion. After contact was made a trade route and treaties were set up quickly, but unlike other races the Draconians didn't seek a position in the Council or even a representative at first. It was not until another 15 years till a member of the Draconian royal family volunteered to take the position in order to lean of the other races in the galaxy. Her name was Tira'gar Sinlu Dracones, Dracones is the royal name taken from they're worlds name Draconia.

Draconians have a humanoid build but are quite tall standing a average of 7 to 15 feet in height depending on age, some of the older Draconians are said to be even bigger. There bodies are covered in scales that are made up of hair that have congealed into harden scales due to oils in there skin. There colors can rang widely from across the color spectrum. Their colors are always two toned one darker color and a secondary lighter color running from their jaw to the tip of there tail. Other facial traits vary from hair, horns, tusks, and spines. Common to all are prehensile tails clawed fingers and toes, forked sticky tongue that can extend out like a frogs, and wing like appendages that allow them limited flight.

Draconians are also naturally biotic users but can not use it as other races in stead they fire biotic blast from there mouths with varying effects. These rang form a pure blast of biotic energy to fire balls, gout's of flame, freezing energy, spiting a biotic acid, a bolt of lighting, or shards of ice. It is not known why there biotic powers manifest as such but it is looked upon as a blessing. Even being consider a sign of adulthood when there biotic breath manifests.

Another unique trait is that any other race they mate with even Asari will result in a draconian birth (though with Asari its a 50/50 chance).

Because of there size and strength a few have chosen to become mercs or join C-sec, and 3 have even become specters though there exploits are rarely if ever heard of.

154.content:
(note: this is another fan-made species, the story owner can change/delete if he wishes)

The Centurions are an Earth centipede-like race that are almost in conjunction to the protheans in time of space travel but have only scratched the surface of inter-galactic travel, the prototypes have to be installed on dreadnaught-sized ships and so far, all of these prototypes have been destroyed. They are 14 to 38 feet long and can stand up about half their body, the color scheme ranges on the color but the darker colors are male and the lighter ones are female. They have developed arms from their second set of legs and a much more sophisticated and stronger exoskeleton than their earthly cousins. They have a natural talent for engineers and can even bring efficiency up to 75% higher than a modern Albert Einstein with a masters degree in engineering. Although very sophisticated they have some 'primordial' implications such as the fore legs becoming venom claws that inject their prey with a powerful acid that dissolves the victim within seconds.Although they tend to be peaceful, they don't take kindly when they are insulted or mistreated, in extreme cases they sabotage the ship they are in or start screwing the person in their room via a rude wake-up call or deleting their files or digital belongings. They have also managed to alter their DNA to where they can fly via the 4 large wings on their back, although they cant stay in the air for more than 5 hours. They have an acute sense of sight, better than humans at 30/5 but they cant smell very well and they are about the same as a human in hearing. They have evolved to where they don't need to breathe, this allows them to go into the vacuum and survive for 10 hours at most along with going into gassed rooms to clear them out. Only in rare cases have there been a Centurion Biotic, far more powerful than even a highly trained Asari, allowing them to manipulate the atoms of objects but not living things.

Since they are very large and smart, most of them joined the Alliance, allowing them to develop their own type of cloaking tech and applying it on larger scales, the SSD NORMANDY is proof of the Heat cloak they developed.

Another unique trait is they seem to be unwilling to mate with other races, nobody knows why or how they developed this 'anxiety' or when it came to being, they also call themselves by human names such as "Yuri" or "Price" when around themselves or with others.
154.title: other fan made race

155.content:
Vorcha: Known for their unique biology and aggressive behavior, the vorcha are a primitive race that live among the galaxy's darker and more dangerous locations, such as Omega. Many vorcha are trained by the krogan Blood Pack as mercenaries due to their savage nature and adaptability to different environments. The rest of galactic civilization regards them as pests and scavengers, and their presence is generally seen as a blight.

Drell: The drell are a reptile-like race that were rescued from their dying homeworld by the hanar following first contact between the two. Since then, the drell have remained loyal to the hanar for their camaraderie and have fit comfortably into galactic civilization.
155.title: other race from Mass effect

1553.content: Hanar: The hanar are a species resembling Earth's jellyfish and are one of the few non-bipedal Citadel races. Hanar are known for their intense politeness when speaking, and their strong religious beliefs regarding the Protheans, whom they refer to as "the Enkindlers".

info.brief_description: Become one of the famed Specters on Citadel Station and the known Galaxy.
info.description:
Its been several weeks since the Geth attacked Citadel station and the giant living machine organism known as a Reaper code named "Sovereign" by the first human Specter Commander Shepard was destroyed in the first"Mass Effect". On patrol a ship receives a distress signal from a colony of an Geth attack reacting to the call the ship and its crew find the planet under heavy attack from the Geth. The Geth no longer under guidance of Saren or the giant Reaper named "Sovereign" have begun to attack colonies at random. To combat the Geth scientist are in the testing stages of a new weapon that will destroy the Geth code named "Red Rose".

Project "Red Rose" is not necessarily a weapon instead it is a newly devised jammer that is intended to block the Geths ability to communicate with each other and work less effectively. Initial testing phases of this new jammer on several planets during the Geths invasion have proven to be successful however major field testing of Project "Red Rose" has yet to be made upon a ship. Current theories are that it can work on any ship ranging from corvette sized ships to dreadnought sized ships. A major draw back of Project "Red Rose" is that it renders the "cloaked" ability of ships like the "SSV NORMANDY" useless when installed on a ship. Current analysis place the cause of this to be due to the amount of heat given off while active as well as the hyper frequency or sub frequency that it can generate.

Some side notes to keep in consideration:

1. Try to keep to the technology level in the game when possible. Though bending the technology curve is allowable just no invincibility shields or "Death Star" like weaponry.
2. Feel free to create your own ship but remember a Specter dosent fly around in giant flashy ships that attract every one in the systems attention like a ship the size of dreadnought or carrier.
3. Anything that involves shrinking to six inches tall, the swallowing of, hermaphrodites, inflating, and other varieties of those type's will not be tolerated. There are already far too many of those that involve shrinking, growing, weight gain, Vore, etc. And will subsequently result in me changing your chapter to fit the story sorry.
4. Have fun with it! Create a new world if you want other then the first three things I mentioned the floor is open for you to add your additions to it.

Also if anyone already came up with this idea for a interactive or other form of story on here apologies. I will be keeping an updated record here for those who add themselves into the database which will include your characters name and if you want your account with it also.
